titles.title: Providing for the expenses of certain committees of the House of Representatives in the One Hundred Eighth Congress.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on House Administration. H. Rept. 108-91.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in House

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 35.

action.text: Consideration initiated pursuant to a previous order.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 148.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous order of the House.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/8/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the House on May 6, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Declares that there shall be paid, out of the applicable accounts of the House of Representatives, not more than specified amounts for certain committees of the House of Representatives in the 108th Congress. Sets forth first session and second session limitations. Allows the Committee on House Administration to adjust the total allowed for any of the named committees under specified circumstances.
